I've just run across this June 2020 paper on public attitudes in the UK about who controls their data. (It's about all data, not just health, but health data is discussed .) Anyone else seen it?

“The survey found that respondents dislike the current approach in which commercial organizations control their personal data and prefer approaches that give them control over their data,…”

https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/2053951720935616
